events.title: Mainstream Introduction to Libre Money (Monnaie Libre)
events.description: Attilax & Paulart from Toile Francilienne will  present the "Monnaie Libre" ("Libre Money") project and the underlying paradigm shift it entails. They will answer to questions such as; Where does Libre Money comes from? Who created it and why? How does it work and what makes it so different from other moneys up to now?

events.title: Fork me, I am famous, a workshop by Fred Zicmama
events.description:
Ḡ1sms+ :: Local Global Banking System.
The free neobank in which bankers are true friends... you actually create money with them! We will demo G1sms, G1Dab, G1Tx terminals, we will show G1Tag, G1 (ZEN) container on IPFS, G1Bot (multichanel) and its internal API, a cashless system based on G1smsn etc.

events.title: Social Engineering: Can Mentalist Really Read Our Thoughts?
events.description: Is it possible to influence and change our perceptions? Over his talk/show, Pierre Boc, mentalist, Ph.D in biology, and consultant for tech firms, will unveil the techniques used by mentalists and how to apply them to daily life. Since the major IT vulnerability is often located "between the chair and the keyboard", social engineering is definitely an area we should all learn more about.

events.title: Design and Implementation of a Decentralized Marketplace: Challenges and Lessons Learned, by Gilles Fedak
events.description: For more than twenty years, applications based on P2P logic deliver more freedom to their users. From file-sharing to cryptocurrencies, they have revolutionized the way we design distributed systems, at a technical level and beyond. We believe that now is the time for a new wave of P2P systems: decentralized marketplaces. Relying on blockchains, they enable anyone to exchange services and monetize resources with no reliance on a trusted third party. Gilles will share the lessons learned at iExec with respect to the challenges faced when designing and deploying such a decentralized marketplace.

events.title: Mainstream Introduction to the Berty Protocol
events.description:
@Moul, founder of Berty.tech and his team will introduce IPFS and share lessons learned while building their technology. Berty.tech has won the OMG Feature Award at the IPFS Camp 2019 in Barcelona.
Berty is an NGO dedicated to building technology for protecting individuals, journalists, whistleblowers and citizens from any form of censorship and surveillance.

events.orga: Dr Sonia Ben Mlkhtar - CNRS, LIRIS-DRIM
events.title: Building privacy-preserving online services: application to Web search and video streaming systems
events.description:
Online services (e.g. search engines, location-based services, video on demand, recommendation engines) require a massive amount of personal data harvested from their users. These data, such as location coordinates or search request history, can reveal highly sensitive user information such as political, religious, or sexual preferences.
I will describe the risks stemming from the use of online services with respect to personal data and I will introduce a prospective approach for personal data protection based on decentralization and the use of hardened CPUs (e.g. Intel SGX). I will focus on two specific applications: Web requests and VOD systems.

events.title: Protocole - A Documentary About Bitcoin & Cryptocurrencies + Q&A with Rémi Crussière
events.description:
Protocole is plugged to the « cryptosphere », where one can meet users and supporters of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, as well as entrepreneurs and researchers.

Giving them a voice makes it obvious that Bitcoin as a way of challenging monetary institutions is actually part of larger trend of the society as a whole. Cryptocurrency are not just a new "asset class", but complex and far-reaching social phenomenon.

events.title: Nothing to hide - A Documentary About Surveillance
events.description: This documentary shows how the general population is keen to accept to be under constant surveillance. "Fascinating" (Inrocks), "Eye-opener" (Forbes), "Worrying" (France 24)

events.title: The Internet's Own Boy - A Documentary About Aaron Swartz
events.description: The film depicts the life of American computer programmer, writer, political organizer, and Internet activist Aaron Swartz.

events.title: ZeroNet : Workshop - Open, free and uncensorable websites, using Bitcoin cryptography and BitTorrent network.
events.description: ZERONET WORKSHOP : After a brief presentation of ZeroNet, Lola will help participants to install ZeroNet, post on the network, create a site, check interesting sites, install plugins, backup one's private key, etc.

events.title: LibTorrent : Workshop - Libtorrent is a feature complete C++ bittorrent implementation focusing on efficiency and scalability. It runs on embedded devices as well as desktops.
events.description: How to create your own minimal BitTorrent client with Python. Introduction to libtorrent, its documentation and the module for using it in an app written in Python.

events.title: Introduction to IPFS and Berty Protocol, by Antoine E
events.description: What is IPFS? How does it work? How can it be used? What is Berty and how did they use IPFS in their project? Lessons learned by Antoine E.

events.title: How to Join and Contribute to Open Source Projects, by Manfred T
events.description: Many developers have misconceptions about open source collaboration. Being a bit shy and afraid to make a mistake is a frequent reason for not contributing, and so is just not knowing about how to start. This talk will share lessons learned about open collaboration, both for project leads and independent contributors.

events.title: Panel: Will 2020 be the Year of DAOs?
events.description: Panel with Louis Giraux (Association Aragon), Adrien Berthou (Genesis DAO, PolkaDAO, DAO), Alex Masmej (MetaCartel, Stake DAO, Marketing DAO) - moderated par Philippe Honigman

events.title: A History of Decentralized Thought
events.description: Daniel Shavit is the co-founder of DAOincubator and Research Lead at Pando Network and Aragon Black

events.title: From Multisig to Revenue-Generating DAOs
events.description: Alex Masmej is part of the original MetaCartel DAO, which was grants-giving. New bigger steps are yet to come, and Alex will be giving a sneak peek into its future.

events.title: Presentation of the ARK Ecosystem and its most recent developments, by François-Xavier Thoorens
events.description: ARK Ecosystem is the multistakeholder co-op that created the ARK blockchain. François-Xavier will present both the organization of the co-op and the DPoS-based protocol, including its latest features.

events.title: Workshop DAOcanvas
events.description: This workshop is offered by festDAO and Adrien Berthou, as a practical and participative introduction to DAO design. It will include a general presentation of DAO principles, a quick demo of a DAO in production, and a co-creation session based on the DAO canvas.

events.title: Introduction to cryptocurrency for women, by @mamiecrypto
events.description: @LesHackeuses et leurs complices soutiennent la volonté des femmes à prendre leur place dans l’écosystème blockchain. La stratégie est de rentrer intelligemment dans l’écosystème pour le faire évoluer de l’intérieur (d’où le nom : @LesHackeuses).
